results.title: One in a million
results.creator_credit: Government of Tasmania Department of Film Production
results.brief_description: An experiment in the fluoridation of drinking water by Beaconsfield Council, Tasmania. The local chemist was the driving force in having the Council add the necessary one part fluoride to a million parts of water. Comparisons over the years of teeth of children brought up on Council’s fluoridated water supply and the teeth of children from outlying areas using tank water amply justifies fluoridation. The benefit to general health, cost and lack of adverse effects on persons or industry.

results.title: One day in the life of Rajko Maksim
results.brief_description: A look at a goose herd in rural Yugoslavia. From early morning Rajku Maksim gathers together the villagers’ geese until it is time to return them at dusk. A non-narrated photographic essay. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: On the thread of a tale
results.creator_credit: Constantin Mustetea and Animation Film Studio
results.brief_description: Animated fairy tale with characters created out of a gradually unwinding ball of yarn. Depicts the adventures of Prince Charming and his fabulous horse, in search of his ladylove who has been captured by an ogre.

results.title: Of men and ideas
results.creator_credit: Ed Weiss, Ed Wegener and WOI Television
results.brief_description: Indicates that in the broadest sense general semantics is concerned with the factors in communication that lead to misunderstanding, tension and conflict. The film identifies and discusses four elements generally associated with most human behaviour. Makes the point that, in terms of resultant behaviour, we ought to be able to distinguish between assessments that make sense and those that do not.

results.title: Oddities of the law. No. 1. Laws of the road
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at several quirks in local road law. Short scenes dramatise the consequences of such laws, providing ample humour with: the New Hampshire ruling that when tow cars arrive at an intersection, neither can go until the other has passed; the New Mexico statute that forbids cars with “inharmonious” horns; the California law that forbids bicycles from over-taking firetrucks; and the Milwaukee by-law that states that no vehicle can park in one place for more than two hours unless it is attached to a horse.
